website_summaries.verdict: A quality choice for catering a child's party, as one batch of batter makes about 20 small waffle bowls.
pros: When pre-heated, it cooks waffles evenly
These cups are on the smaller side, only using about 1 tablespoon of batter per cup
One batch of batter will make roughly 20 cups
Each set of cups takes only a minute to cook all the way through
cons: Sits at a higher price point than its competitors

customer_reviews.title: works great, just use nonstick cooking spray!
customer_reviews.text: NOTE: You have to let it heat up all the way, apply a nonstick cooking spray to both sides and then pour your waffle batter in for them to work. Sure they may be nonstick surfaces but if you do not do this you will have a messy broken bowl that is hard to get off. If you do this the product works wonders and the bowls cook in moments.

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: For those that have burning problems. Do not follow the cooking time or the green light. It only takes between 1 min and 1 1/2 min. I check after 1 min. The waffle is very thin and will burn quickly. For those that have sticking problems. Spray both sides with cooking spray every time for the first 5 or so bowls. So simple to use, but you do have to pay attention. When it says to fill with 1 Tablespoon, that's what it means. It takes very little batter.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda

customer_reviews.title: very thin, but super fun
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize that the waffle bowls would be quite so thin. I have a friend with a waffle boat maker and these are nothing like those. They are also difficult to remove from the cups. Some were overdone because they would get "stuck" and take me a while to pop them out. That being said, They are cute, they cook very quickly, and they are super fun. We made waffles from the recipe in the booklet that comes with it and they were good. We used them with yogurt & fruit, eggs & crumbled bacon with syrup drizzled on , and even ice-cream sundaes! Fun for the kids. A great price.
customer_reviews.author: persnikkety

customer_reviews.title: Hint on timing
customer_reviews.text: One recipe makes about 20-28 bowls, more than I can easily use at once, but they store well. I think one element in mine is out, so it doesn't brown on one quarter, so I give it a turn and another few seconds, and they're even all around. I don't know if this is a peculiarity of my individual unit or a problem with all of the bowl makers, so I thought I'd pass on the easy fix. It takes about 3 minutes a pair, so making them ahead is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Tchipakkan

customer_reviews.title: The recipe that came with it is great and the little bowls serve multi-purposes
customer_reviews.text: Just what I've been wanting. The recipe that came with it is great and the little bowls serve multi-purposes. I've used them as ice cream cones, and as an interesting presentation for a chicken dish I do that is similar to chicken a la king. I'm sure I'll find more uses for them. Heats up in a jiffy and cooks quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. J. A. Metcalf

customer_reviews.title: FUN family time ...for price of a movie ticket
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for mothers day. My wife and teenage daughters had fun experimenting making cups for ice cream sundaes. About the cost of a movie ticket, this was entertaining for nearly as long. We've used it twice so far. I like the surface is teflon, so cups remove easily. The cups are approximately 2.5 inches diameter at the bottom, 3 inches diameter at the top, about 1.25 inches deep. Two cups cook in about 2 minutes. So the cups are not very big - they hold 1 scoop of ice cream and a few toppings.
customer_reviews.author: Dave M.

customer_reviews.title: waffle bowl
customer_reviews.text: Great item for under $12. I used boxed waffle mix and was happy with results. There is a need to experiment with batter, if too thick the shells do not crisp on bottoms. Fill with scoops of ice cream, fresh berries, etc. Bowls are small, about 3.5" x 1.5"

customer_reviews.title: Bella Waffle Bowl maker
customer_reviews.text: I used it only once so far. I used non stick on it as in the directions. The cups would stick to the top. I used a silicone scrapper to remove it and it wouldn't budge. I had to use my oven glove to remove it and it ruin the shape because it wouldn't release easily. The cup on the right side would not make a complete shape and was unusable. It may have been the recipe of the pancake mix I used as it made very thin cups. I will give it a try again with a different mix and hope for better results.

customer_reviews.title: Fun product!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product as a Sweetest Day gift for my spouse. We frequently have family over for homemade ice cream, so this seemed like a good addition. It does work as advertised, and the waffle bowls are tasty. Although the waffle bowls are easy to make, it will take practice to have them turn out as well as ones from the supermarket. It is also a slow process since you can only bake two bowls at a time, so start early if you are expecting a lot people. The waffle bowls do freeze well. The unit cleans easily, too.
customer_reviews.author: Concerned Consumer
